title: Provide an in-app downloadable ZIP of the full landing page project (alternative to missing Export button)

requirements.text: Add a downloadable ZIP artifact of the full project (frontend + backend) into the repository as a static file so users can download the code even when the platform UI “Download/Export code” button is not visible.

quotes: Yes please do you I want you to package your full landing page code into a ZIP now?

acceptanceCriteria: A ZIP file containing the full project source (including both `frontend/` and `backend/`) is added under `frontend/public/assets/downloads/` (or equivalent static public directory) and is served as a static asset by the deployed site.
The ZIP downloads successfully in the browser and unzips without errors.
The ZIP includes the current landing page code (not an empty placeholder).

requirements.text: Expose the ZIP download via the landing page UI by adding a clearly labeled download link/button in the site footer, and include a short one-line instruction indicating that this is the full source code download.

quotes: I can generate a fresh ZIP of your full project right here in the chat and send it to you directly.
Yes please do you I want you to package your full landing page code into a ZIP now?

acceptanceCriteria: The footer renders a visible control labeled in English (e.g., “Download source code (ZIP)”).
Clicking the control downloads the ZIP from the static asset path added in REQ-1.
The link uses safe attributes when appropriate (e.g., no navigation away from the landing page is required; if opening a new tab is used, `rel="noopener noreferrer"` is set).

constraints: Do not edit files under `frontend/src/components/ui` or any paths listed in `frontend.immutablePaths` in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Backend must remain single-actor Motoko (no additional backend services).
nonGoals: Do not implement a dynamic “zip generation” feature at runtime inside the canister.
Do not add new authentication flows or require Internet Identity for downloading the ZIP.
